intro: Crambe quadricostata, commonly known as the four-ribbed crambe, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Crambe quadricostata is an annual plant that produces elongated pods containing several seeds.
